description.plain: Born December 12, 1937 in Newark, New Jersey, with Italian origins, is an American pop singer. She was the top charting female US artist of the late 1950s and early 1960s.

body.plain: Born December 12, 1937 in Newark, New Jersey, with Italian origins, is an American pop singer. She was the top charting female US artist of the late 1950s and early 1960s.

songs.full_title: I Will Wait For You by Connie Francis
songs.title: I Will Wait For You
songs.embed_content: Read “I Will Wait For You” by Connie Francis on Genius

album.full_title: Movie Greats of the 60s by Connie Francis
album.name: Movie Greats of the 60s

annotatable.link_title: I Will Wait For You by Connie Francis
annotatable.title: I Will Wait For You

songs.lyrics:
7 ContributorsI Will Wait For You Lyrics[Chorus]
If it takes forever, I will wait for you
For a thousand summers, I will wait for you
Till you're back beside me, till I'm holding you
Till I hear you sigh here in my arms

[Verse 1]
Anywhere you wander, anywhere you go
Every day remember how I love you so
In your heart believe what in my heart I know
That forevermore I'll wait for you

[Verse 2]
The clock will tick away the hours one by one
Then the time will come when all the waiting's done
The time when you return and find me here and run
Straight to my waiting arms

[Chorus]
If it takes forever, I will wait for you
For a thousand summers, I will wait for you
Till you're here beside me, till I'm touching you
And forevermore sharing our love
Till you're here beside me, till I'm touching you
And forevermore
I will wait for youYou might also likeEmbed

songs.full_title: Stupid Cupid by A La Carte
songs.title: Stupid Cupid

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsStupid Cupid Lyrics[Verse 1]
Stupid Cupid, you're a real mean guy (Stupid Cupid)
I'd like to clip your wings so you can't fly (Stupid Cupid)
I'm in love and it's a crying shame (Stupid Cupid)
And I know that you're the one to blame

[Chorus]
Hey hey, set me free
Stupid Cupid, stop picking on me

[Verse 2]
I can't do my homework and I can't think straight (Stupid Cupid)
I meet him every morning 'bout a half past eight (Stupid Cupid)
I'm acting like a lovesick fool (Stupid Cupid)
You've even got me carrying his books to school (Stupid Cupid)

[Chorus]
Hey hey, set me free
Stupid Cupid, stop picking on me

[Bridge]
You mixed me up for good right from the very start
Hey, go play, Robin Hood, with somebody else's heart

[Verse 3]
You've got me jumping like a crazy clown (Stupid Cupid)
And I don't feature what you're putting down (Stupid Cupid)
Since I kissed his loving lips of wine (Stupid Cupid)
The thing that bothers me is that I like it fine (Stupid Cupid)
You might also like[Chorus]
Hey hey, set me free
Stupid Cupid, stop picking on me

[Instrumental Break]

[Verse 3]
You've got me jumping like a crazy clown (Stupid Cupid)
And I don't feature what you're putting down (Stupid Cupid)
Since I kissed his loving lips of wine (Stupid Cupid)
The thing that bothers me is that I like it fine (Stupid Cupid)

[Chorus]
Hey hey, set me free
Stupid Cupid, stop picking on me
Hey hey, set me free
Stupid Cupid, stop picking on me

[Outro]
Stupid Cupid
Stupid Cupid
Stupid CupidEmbed

songs.lyrics:
9 ContributorsWho’s Sorry Now LyricsWho's sorry now?
Who's sorry now?
Whose heart is aching for breaking each vow?
Who's sad and blue?
Who's crying too?
Just like I cried over you

Right to the end
Just like a friend
I tried to warn you somehow
You had your way
Now you must pay
I'm glad that you're sorry now

Right to the end
Just like a friend
I tried to warn you somehow
You had your way
Now you must pay
